title: Johor authorities seize 11 floor mats bearing Kaabah images from supermarket
summary: The Johor State Islamic Religious Affairs Department seized 11 floor mats bearing the images of the Kaabah from a supermarket in the district on Tuesday.
content:
BATU PAHAT (April 13): The Johor State Islamic Religious Affairs Department seized 11 floor mats bearing the images of the Kaabah from a supermarket in the district on Tuesday.

State Islamic Religious Affairs Committee chairman Mohd Fared Mohd Khalid said the floor mats were confiscated following complaints from the public.

He said the supermarket management had been called up to provide explanations, and warned to exercise caution over the products they se

title: Aidilfitri: Traffic still slow on some highways as of 5pm on Saturday
summary:
The traffic flow on several major highways was reportedly still slow as of 5pm on Saturday.

A Malaysian Highway Authority spokesman said a high volume of vehicles on the North-South Expressway (PLUS) and the East Coast Expressway Phase Two (LPT2) had caused a congestion along several stretches.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 13): The traffic flow on several major highways was reportedly still slow as of 5pm on Saturday.

A Malaysian Highway Authority spokesman said a high volume of vehicles on the North-South Expressway (PLUS) and the East Coast Expressway Phase Two (LPT2) had caused a congestion along several stretches. 

He noted that on the LPT2, traffic was moving slowly from Bukit Besi to Paka, and at the Kuala Terengganu Toll Plaza exit.</

title: PH still discussing candidate for Kuala Kubu Baharu by-election, says Gobind
summary: Pakatan Harapan (PH) is still discussing the candidate for the Kuala Kubu Baharu by-election, said DAP national deputy chairman Gobind Singh Deo.
content:
KUALA KUBU BAHARU (April 13): Pakatan Harapan (PH) is still discussing the candidate for the Kuala Kubu Baharu by-election, said DAP national deputy chairman Gobind Singh Deo.

Gobind, who is also the Selangor DAP chairman, said his party had received many names as the PH candidate for the by-election, and a list of names is being considered.

"Discussions with PH Selangor have been held, and the candidate decided will be brought to the ce

title: Fahmi denies billions in royalties deposited into PKR's accounts
summary: Parti Keadilan Rakyat (PKR) information chief Fahmi Fadzil has denied allegations that billions of ringgit in royalty funds for Kelantan and Terengganu were deposited into the party's accounts.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 13): Parti Keadilan Rakyat (PKR) information chief Fahmi Fadzil has denied allegations that billions of ringgit in royalty funds for Kelantan and Terengganu were deposited into the party's accounts.

"There are individuals who upload fake and defamatory posts, which are very disgusting. Keadilan discloses its accounts every time a congress is held, and these accounts are audited by certified auditors.

"Never

title: Unity govt to discuss allocations for opposition on Wednesday, says Fadillah
summary: The demands for allocations by opposition Members of Parliament will be discussed in the Unity Government Leadership Council meeting next Wednesday.
content:
KUCHING (April 13): The demands for allocations by opposition Members of Parliament will be discussed in the Unity Government Leadership Council meeting next Wednesday.

Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Fadillah Yusof said this follows his meeting with Opposition Leader Datuk Seri Hamzah Zainudin in Parliament on March 19.

"In the meeting, the opposition said they want allocations and any conditions [to give allocations] are up to the government [to set].

title: The Week Ahead: Malaysia 1Q advance GDP estimate, March trade data in focus
summary: This week’s key focus on the local front will be on Malaysia’s advance gross domestic product (GDP) estimate for the first quarter of 2024 (1Q2024), which is scheduled to be released on April 19.
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on April 15, 2024 - April 21, 2024

This week’s key focus on the local front will be on Malaysia’s advance gross domestic product (GDP) estimate for the first quarter of 2024 (1Q2024), which is scheduled to be released on April 19.

title: Are commodities at the start of a secular bull run?
summary: The uptrend in prices of a number of commodities — reflected in the 14.2% rise in the S&P GSCI from its recent December trough — brought back memories of the commodity bull run in 2021 and 2022, when the effects of the Covid-19 pandemic followed by the war in Ukraine choked global supply chains and sent food prices higher.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 13): The uptrend in prices of a number of commodities — reflected in the 14.2% rise in the S&P GSCI from its recent December trough — brought back memories of the commodity bull run in 2021 and 2022, when the effects of the Covid-19 pandemic followed by the war in Ukraine choked global supply chains and sent food prices higher.

There are several key themes that seem to be affecting commodity prices, the most positive factor being the bottoming of China’s economy. A pickup in economic ac

title: Oil settles up on Mideast tensions, posts weekly loss
summary: Oil rose around 1% on Friday on geopolitical tensions in the Middle East but posted a weekly loss on a bearish world oil demand growth forecast from the International Energy Agency (IEA) and worries about slower US interest rate cuts.
content:
Brent crude futures settled up 71 cents at US$90.45 a barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude futures rose 64 cents to US$85.66.

NEW YORK: Oil rose around 1% on Friday on geopolitical tensions in the Middle East but posted a weekly loss on a bearish world oil demand growth forecast from the International Energy Agency (IEA) and worries about slower US interest rate cuts.

title: Wall St Week Ahead: Surging US energy shares reflect robust growth
summary: US energy shares are soaring as investors benefit from rising oil prices and a stronger-than-expected economy, while seeking to protect their portfolios from a feared resurgence of inflation.
content:
The economy will be in focus in the coming week as first-quarter earnings season heats up.

NEW YORK: US energy shares are soaring as investors benefit from rising oil prices and a stronger-than-expected economy, while seeking to protect their portfolios from a feared resurgence of inflation.

title: Wall St ends sharply lower on sticky inflation
summary: US stocks sold off on Friday after major US banks' results failed to impress, capping a week marked by market-moving inflation data, evolving expectations for US Federal Reserve policy, and looming geopolitical tensions.
content:
The Dow fell 475.84 points, or 1.24%, to 37,983.24. The S&P 500 lost 75.65 points, or 1.46%, at 5,123.41 and the Nasdaq dropped 267.10 points, or 1.62%, to 16,175.09.

NEW YORK: US stocks sold off on Friday after major US banks' results failed to impress, capping a week marked by market-moving inflation data, evolving expectations for US Federal Reserve policy, and looming geopolitical tensions.

title: MyNewsHub's social media operator to give statement on old video clip — MCMC
summary: The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) has called the operator of MyNewsHub news portal's social media account to give a statement regarding the uploading and replaying of an old video clip, which resulted in confusion among social media users.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (April 12): The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) has called the operator of MyNewsHub news portal's social media account to give a statement regarding the uploading and replaying of an old video clip, which resulted in confusion among social media users.

In a statement, MCMC expressed grave concern over the spread of a  one-minute and 10-second video entitled "Tanya pasal kuarters jer dh kene mcm tu depan KSN!!", which was perceived as aiming to portray civil servants ne

title: CPO futures end lower, in line with CBOT soybean oil weakness
summary:
Crude palm oil futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives closed lower, following the weakness of soybean oil futures on Chicago Board of Trade (CBOT).

The CBOT’s soy oil futures fell 0.4% on Friday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (April 12): Crude palm oil futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives closed lower, following the weakness of soybean oil futures on Chicago Board of Trade (CBOT).

The CBOT’s soy oil futures fell 0.4% on Friday.

Palm oil trader David Ng said buying activities will be confined to stock replenishment on a steady basis hence putting pressure on the CPO price.

title: Will EVs take off in Malaysia?
summary: The electric vehicle (EV) industry has a lot of ground momentum driving its growth and adoption globally, but there are still key chokepoints that could impede any widespread adoption locally – at least for the moment.
content:
THE electric vehicle (EV) industry has a lot of ground momentum driving its growth and adoption globally, but there are still key chokepoints that could impede any widespread adoption locally – at least for the moment.

No doubt, the EV sector is still touted as the biggest shift in the automotive industry that is still in progress since the development of the petrol internal combustion engine (ICE) which took off in the 20th Century.

content:
